properties.description: The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (String, Required) The name of this bucket.

properties.name: team_uuid
properties.description:
(String, Required) Unique identifier for the team this bucket
is being created for.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: bucket_id
properties.description: (Required) The id of the bucket to associate this environment with.

properties.name: test_id
properties.description: (Optional) The id of the test to associate this environment with. If given, creates a test specific environment, otherwise creates a shared environment.

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The name of environment.

properties.name: script
properties.description: (Optional) The script to to run to setup the environment

properties.name: preserve_cookies
properties.description: (Optional) If this is set to true, tests using this enviornment will manage cookies between steps.

properties.name: initial_variables
properties.description: (Optional) Map of keys and values being used for variables when the test begins.

properties.name: integrations
properties.description: (Optional) A list of integration ids to enable for test runs using this environment.

properties.name: regions
properties.description: (Optional) A list of Runscope regions to execute test runs in when using this environment.

properties.name: remote_agents
properties.description: (Optional) A list of Remote Agents to execute test runs in when using this environment. Remote Agents documented below.

properties.name: webhooks
properties.description: (Optional) A list of URL's to send results to when test runs using this environment finish.

properties.name: emails
properties.description: (Optional) A list of settings for sending email notifications upon completion of a test run using this environment. Emails block is documented below
Remote Agents (remote_agents) supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the remote agent

properties.name: uuid
properties.description: (Required) The uuid of the remote agent
Emails (emails) supports the following:

properties.name: notify_all
properties.description: (Required) Send an email to all team members according to the notify_on rules.

properties.name: notify_on
properties.description: (Required) Upon completion of a test run Runscope will send email notifications, allowed values: all, failures, threshold or switch

properties.name: notify_threshold
properties.description: (Required) An integer between 1 and 10 for use with the notify_on settings: only used when threshold and switch values are given

properties.name: recipients
properties.description: (Required) A list of recipients to notify, documented below
Recipients (recipients), See team api, supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Optional) The name of the person.

properties.name: id
properties.description: (Optional) The unique identifier for this person's account.

properties.name: email
properties.description: (Optional) The email address for this account.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (String, Required) The name of this test.

properties.name: description
properties.description:
(String, Optional) Human-readable description of the new test.
is being created for.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: bucket_id
properties.description: (Required) The id of the bucket to associate this schedule with.

properties.name: test_id
properties.description: (Required) The id of the test to associate this schedule with.

properties.name: environment_id
properties.description: (Required) The id of the environment to use when running the test. If given, creates a test specific schedule, otherwise creates a shared schedule.

properties.name: list description
1m — every minute
properties.description: • 1m — every minute

properties.name: 5m — every 5 minutes
properties.description: • 5m — every 5 minutes

properties.name: 15m — every 15 minutes
properties.description: • 15m — every 15 minutes

properties.name: 30m — every 30 minutes
properties.description: • 30m — every 30 minutes

properties.name: 1h — every hour
properties.description: • 1h — every hour

properties.name: 6h — every 6 hours
properties.description: • 6h — every 6 hours

properties.name: 1d — every day.
properties.description: • 1d — every day.

properties.name: note
properties.description: (Optional) A human-friendly description for the schedule.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: bucket_id
properties.description: (Required) The id of the bucket to associate this step with.

properties.name: test_id
properties.description: (Required) The id of the test to associate this step with.

properties.name: note
properties.description: = (Optional) A comment attached to the test step.

properties.name: list description
pause
properties.description: • pause

properties.name: condition
properties.description: • condition

properties.name: ghost
properties.description: • ghost

properties.name: subtest
properties.description: • subtest

properties.name: request-steps
properties.description: » Request steps
When creating a request type of step the additional arguments also apply:

properties.name: method
properties.description: (Required) The HTTP method for this request step.

properties.name: variables
properties.description: (Optional) A list of variables to extract out of the HTTP response from this request. Variables documented below.

properties.name: assertions
properties.description: (Optional) A list of assertions to apply to the HTTP response from this request. Assertions documented below.

properties.name: headers
properties.description: (Optional) A list of headers to apply to the request. Headers documented below.

properties.name: body
properties.description: (Optional) A string to use as the body of the request.

properties.name: auth
properties.description: (Optional) The credentials used to authenticate the request

properties.name: before_script
properties.description: (Optional) Runs a script before the request is made

properties.name: script
properties.description: (Optional) Runs a script after the request is made
Variables (variables) supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Name of the variable to define.

properties.name: property
properties.description: (Required) The name of the source property. i.e. header name or json path

properties.name: source
properties.description: (Required) The variable source, for list of allowed values see: https://www.runscope.com/docs/api/steps#assertions
Assertions (assertions) supports the following:

properties.name: source
properties.description: (Required) The assertion source, for list of allowed values see: https://www.runscope.com/docs/api/steps#assertions

properties.name: property
properties.description: (Optional) The name of the source property. i.e. header name or json path

properties.name: comparison
properties.description: (Required) The assertion comparison to make i.e. equals, for list of allowed values see: https://www.runscope.com/docs/api/steps#assertions

properties.name: value
properties.description: (Optional) The value the comparison will use
Example Assertions
Status Code == 200

"assertions": [
    {
        "source": "response_status",
        "comparison": "equal_number",
        "value": 200
    }
]
JSON element 'address' contains the text "avenue"

"assertions": [
    {
        "source": "response_json",
        "property": "address",
        "comparison": "contains",
        "value": "avenue"
    }
]
Response Time is faster than 1 second.

"assertions": [
    {
        "source": "response_time",
        "comparison": "is_less_than",
        "value": 1000
    }
]
The headers list supports the following:

properties.name: header
properties.description: (Required) The name of the header

properties.name: value
properties.description: (Required) The name header value
